Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk docker
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: docker bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Docker is an open-source engine that automates the deployment of any application as a lightweight, portable, self-sufficient container that runs virtually anywhere. The docker packages contain docker version 1.12.6. This update fixes these bugs: Previously, the journald logging driver leaked an open file descriptor when deleting files. This could lead to wasted disk space on /var. This bug has been fixed and space on /var is no longer wasted. (BZ#1401019) Previously, creating many containers simultaneously sometimes lead to a race condition. Consequently, container creation failed when using the devidemapper backend. With this update, the race condition is fixed, and the containers are created successfully. (BZ#1409076) Previously, pulling images from additional registries such as Artifactory did not properly request authorization. This has been fixed, and authorization happens as expected. (BZ#1418939) Previously, if you shut down the docker daemon using systemd, docker could take up to 90 seconds to shut down running containers. With this update, the unit file for the docker daemon has been modified, and the daemon shuts down much faster now. (BZ#1424709) Previously, if you hot-plugged a CPU into the system, the docker daemon did not increment the CPU count. This update fixes the bug. (BZ#1426788) Previously, the docker daemon could become unresponsive under heavy load. With this update, the bug has been fixed, and the docker daemon no longer hangs. (BZ#1427156, BZ#1427212) The previous update accidentally turned on live-restore containers, which are not currently supported on RHEL7. This could cause the docker daemon to hang and to not function properly. This update removes live-restore from the docker daemon configuration and the daemon works properly now. (BZ#1437784) Previously, when processing a Node found in KV store, the docker daemon sometimes became unresponsive due to a race condition. This update fixes this race condition, and docker no longer hangs. (BZ#1446184) Users of docker are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and adds various enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
